content.raw:
I was able to reproduce it and we're gonna look into this. In the meantime, you can workaround this issue by launching the `sim` and the `bridge` separately, as shown below.

```
TERMINAL 1:
$ cd ~/subt_ws/
$ source install/setup.bash
$ ign launch cloudsim_sim.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG

TERMINAL 2:
$ cd ~/subt_ws/
$ source install/setup.bash
$ ign launch cloudsim_bridge.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG1

TERMINAL 3:
$ cd ~/subt_solution
$ source install/setup.bash
$ roslaunch subt_seed x1.launch robot_name:=X1
```

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/842753476-issue175.gif)

I was able to reproduce it and we're gonna look into this. In the meantime, you can workaround this issue by launching the sim and the bridge separately, as shown below.

TERMINAL 1:
$ cd ~/subt_ws/
$ source install/setup.bash
$ ign launch cloudsim_sim.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG

TERMINAL 2:
$ cd ~/subt_ws/
$ source install/setup.bash
$ ign launch cloudsim_bridge.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG1

TERMINAL 3:
$ cd ~/subt_solution
$ source install/setup.bash
$ roslaunch subt_seed x1.launch robot_name:=X1
